reviews.review_msg: Dr. Taylor is such a good prof. I learned so much in his class. If you put in the effort, watch the recorded lectures, and ask questions, you'll get a lot out of this class. He's also very supportive when it comes to writing tips and resources.

It's clear he's very passionate about his field as he would often go on tangents when asked questions. He's quite a tough marker but he leaves lots of feedback and simply wants you to improve. Would take again as he made me interested in US history!

Professor Ferguson is a very nice person and a decent teacher as well. However, she is a tough grader. You really need to think the question through and arrive at a specific thesis. And I wouldn't have a problem with that, it's just her way of structuring and forming questions were extremely vague which made it a bit irritating.

For a 200 level class, she grades as though its a 400 level course. Impossible to make a good grade, especially if your a guy. EVERYTHING is related to Race as far as course material.  Every question is one sided and she hates every ones opinion.  IF you have any opinion or think outside what she calls "history" then stay away from this class.

I can accept the fact that she's hard. It's the fact that she's totally incoherent, condescending, un-engaging... need I go on? I can echo the sentiment that you better be a blithering sycophant to answer any of her typecast essay questions. Worst prof I've had at SFU, tied for worst ever. Could have been a great course.

As Karen had stated in her lecture, she teaches you "the Ferguson" version of U.S History. She assigns questions in a way where you have to agree with her opinion in order to answer the question. Her focus throughout the course is on black civil rights (ie. sharecroppers, civil rights act, etc.)
Hard marker for the papers and she is very picky at the grammer. Ok lecturer.

The woman is brilliant, like talking to a library, I'd like to check her brain out. She should be running the gov't somewhere. Not a great lecturer, scatters her thoughts. True, she's one tough marker, forget about a B if you're a slaker. She's hot if you like the type, reminds me of Marcie from Married w/ Children.
Really hard prof, no doubt about it. Avoid her if you just wanna take an elective for interest. Anybody know if she scales the term? thanks

An amazing prof on the teaching side, very passionate about her work.DO NOT TAKE HER UNLESS YOU ARE A MACHINE! Grades papers with a blowtorch.I'm an A+ student and got solid B's outside the exams.Likes parrots.Think she teaches because she lost her job at the death camp.
Assigned some very interesting reading, but she wasn't easy (but not unfair either) as a grader.  Hottie.

Very insightful and makes class interesting. Dale was helpful, approachable, and organized. Class textbooks were longer but actually enjoyable to read and very relevant to course material and there was never an awkward silence in discussions. One the best American history professors at SFU, if you have the chance to take a class with him take it!

Great prof!  Entertaining lectures and very helpful.  Discussions in tutorial were enjoyable w/ lots of content about current events.  High amount of reading for a 200 level course but you'll want to keep on top of it for tutorial. Mark was based off tutorial, midterm, final, & a 2000 word paper. Reasonably difficult course but he's a fair marker.
Amazing lecturer, powerful discussions about American history throughout the semester. There is a lot to remember.
